sentences.english: Babies tumble when they are learning to walk.
sentences.chinese: 幼兒在學走路時常常跌倒。

sentences.english: From time to time, some of my readers take a stab at converting me to their religion.
sentences.chinese: 我的一些讀者時常嘗試把我轉變成他們的宗教的信徒。

sentences.english: Of course, Beijing is often also able to exploit these seeming incongruities.
sentences.chinese: 當然，北京也時常能夠從這些不協調的情況中獲益。

sentences.english: I always jump introduction to read books.
sentences.chinese: 我看書時常常略去緒論。

sentences.english: These lines have often no connection whatever with the book which contains them.
sentences.chinese: 那樣的幾行字時常是和他手中的書毫無關係的。

sentences.english: However, its role is more that of a super-heavy tank destroyer.
sentences.chinese: 怎麼說呢，他時常扮演一個超重型的坦克殺手角色。

sentences.english: Those who in quarrels interpose must often wipe a bloody nose.
sentences.chinese: 那些吵架的調停者必須時常抹鼻血。

sentences.english: Why must I go about mourning, oppressed by the enemy?
sentences.chinese: 我爲何因仇敵的欺壓時常哀痛呢？

sentences.english: Hyaline arteriolosclerosis with hypertension or diabetes mellitus is usually present.
sentences.chinese: 高血壓或糖尿病時常出現動脈玻璃樣變。

sentences.english: We can love young, but we are often forget to like his respect for the same.
sentences.chinese: 我們能夠愛幼，但我們卻時常忘了像愛幼一樣尊老。

sentences.english: He looked taut, nervous, often miserable.
sentences.chinese: 他看起來緊張不安，時常流露出痛苦神情。

sentences.english: Every now and then,people's bodies get possessed.
sentences.chinese: 時常有人們肉體被奪舍的事件。

sentences.english: His grandfather noticed that he would often improvise melodies as he played with his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父注意到他在玩玩具時常常即興哼出旋律來。

sentences.english: Too often we judge people on too little information.
sentences.chinese: 我們時常通過一點點信息來評斷一個人。

sentences.english: But it always best to be wary of these eager to come to our rescue.
sentences.chinese: 我們時常會需要幫助，於是我們只好有求於人。

sentences.english: These are addressed to our training company commander Liu often shouted words.
sentences.chinese: 以上都是劉連長在給我們訓練時常喊的話。

definition: from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
